intro: Tylecodon cremnophilus, commonly known as the rock fig, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are usually small and may be present or reduced depending on the species. Tylecodon cremnophilus thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments.
